content.title: One Stop Centre
content.department: Ministry of Women and Child Development
content.details: One Stop Centres (OSC) are intended to support women affected by violence, in private and public spaces, within the family, community and at the workplace. Women facing physical, sexual, emotional, psychological and economic abuse, irrespective of age, class, caste, education status, marital status, race and culture will be facilitated with support and redressal.
eligibility: All women facing physical, sexual, emotional, psychological, and economic abuse, irrespective of age, class, caste, education status, marital status, race, and culture.
documents_required: No documents are required for application. You may carry your valid Identification card.

faqs.question: What kind of Emergency Response and Rescue Services is provided?
faqs.answer: OSC will provide rescue and referral services to the women affected by violence.

faqs.question: What kind of Medical assistance is provided?
faqs.answer: Women affected by violence would be referred to the nearest Hospital for medical aid/examination.

faqs.question: What kind of Police assistance is provided?
faqs.answer: Facilitate/Assisting in filing First Information Report (FIR/NCR) is provided.

faqs.question: What is meant by Shelter as a service?
faqs.answer: The OSC will provide temporary shelter facility to aggrieved women.

faqs.question: What is the meaning of Video Conferencing Facility?
faqs.answer: Video Conferencing facility is provided under the scheme to facilitate online police and court proceedings.
